text:
http://home.houston.rr.com/curta/stylebug.zip contains a small project that 
will demonstrate the <style> task locking up for a particular combination of 
transform and source document.

The task appears to lock up only for this particular source document (several 
hundred other documents are successfully processed in the real project), 
running the transform manually works as expected with no errors or warnings.

To run, configure ant 1.4.1 or the CVS version with the optional.jar and 
Xerces and Xalan from Xalan-J 2.1 (or 2.2 D11, didn't seem to make a 
different).  And run "ant" or "ant dom1-core-gen-java".  A successful 
completion will produce a non-zero length file 
build/java/org/w3c/domts/level1/core/documentcreatecdatasection.java

As a first data point - it works without any problems if I use SAXON 6.4.4
instead of Xalan - and it doesn't really lock up using Xalan, it is eating

creator: carnold@houston.rr.com
text:
I had not previously been able to reproduce the problem from the command line, 
so it looked like it was some strange interaction between ant and xalan, hence 
the filing as a Ant bug.  However, I've now encountered the problem from the 
command line, so it is likely a Xalan bug and not an integration bug.  Running 
out of time for the evening, will try to reproduce with latest CVS sources for 
Xalan.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
It could be a strange problem that appears when Xalan gets low on memory,
there will natutally be less space available on the stack and heap when
Xalan gets run via Ant.

Would you please mark this bug invalid if after you've confirmed it is not an
Ant bug?  Thanks.

Looks like a Xalan bug that occurred between Xalan-J 2.1 and 2.2D13, however 
other bugs (4858) are preventing confirming that the problem is fixed.
